background: This protocol was established to evaluate trends in the timing and extent of spawning by Kootenai River white sturgeon. This protocol includes evaluation of spawning events by sampling drifting larvae and evaluating abundance. Methods used in this protocol have been in use since 1996 by Paragamian. We hope to answer whether changes in physical habit proplosed by KTOI (Habitat Master Plan no. wt141243) will change spawning locations or timing and reproductive success.
title: KRRFM - White sturgeon larval hatching success
assumptions: River scale sampling issues will obscure results. Our gear are effective at sampling drifting larvae.
objectives: Restore natural recruitment of Kootenai River white sturgeon
